question: A metallic rod of length 1 m held along east-west direction is allowed to fall down freely. Given horizontal component of earth's magnetic field <katex>$B_{H}=3\times10^{-5}T$</katex>. The emf induced in the rod at an instant <katex>$t=2s$</katex> after it is released is (Take <katex>$g=10ms^{-2}$</katex>)
explanation: The rod falls vertically, cutting the horizontal component of Earth's magnetic field (<katex>$B_H$</katex>). Note: Since it is aligned East-West and falls, it cuts the horizontal North-South flux lines.
Velocity at <katex>$t=2s$</katex> is <katex>$v = u + gt = 0 + 10(2) = 20 ms^{-1}$</katex>.
